member.summary: Initializes the object, prior to it becoming visible on the screen.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.DesktopObject.CanClose
member.summary: Asks the object whether it is in a closable state without user intervention.
member.remarks: The default implementation just returns true. Override this method to customize the behaviour. The object must respond to this method without interacting with the user. Therefore it should respond conservatively (e.g. respond with false if there may be unsaved data).
member.returns: True if the object can be closed, otherwise false.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.DesktopObject.PrepareClose(Macro.Desktop.CloseReason)
member.summary: Gives the object an opportunity to prepare before being closed.
member.remarks: The object is free to interact with the user in this method, in order to make any preparations prior to being closed. The object may return false if it still cannot close (e.g. there is unsaved data, and the user, when prompted, elects to cancel the close operation).
member.param: The reason for closing the object.
member.returns: True if the object is ready to close, or false it the object cannot be closed.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.ISuggestionProvider
member.summary: Defines an interface to an object that provides suggestions dynamically based on text entered by the user.
member.remarks: This interface has been designed so that the implementation may optionally provide suggestions in an asynchronous manner. member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.NavigatorComponentContainer
member.summary: An application component that acts as a container for other application components.
member.remarks: The child components are treated as "pages", where each page is a node in a tree. Only one page is displayed at a time, however, a navigation tree is provided on the side to aid the user in navigating the set of pages.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationComponent

member.summary: Notifies subscribers of the that all properties may have changed.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationComponent.SetHost(Macro.Desktop.IApplicationComponentHost)
member.summary: Called by the framework to set the host.
member.remarks: For internal framework use only.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationComponent.Start
member.summary: Called by the host to initialize the application component.
member.remarks: Override this method to implement custom initialization logic. Overrides must be sure to call the base implementation.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationComponent.Stop
member.summary: Called by the host when the application component is being terminated.
member.remarks: Override this method to implement custom termination logic. Overrides must be sure to call the base implementation.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationComponent.CanExit
member.summary: Called by the framework to determine if this component is in a state such that it can be stopped without user interaction.

remarks.para: The behaviour of the default implementation depends upon the type of host. If the component is running in an or an , this method always returns true. Otherwise, it checks the property and returns false if data has been modified.
Override this method to provide custom logic for responding to this query.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationComponent.PrepareExit
member.summary: Called by the framework in the case where the host has initiated the exit, rather than the component, to give the component a chance to prepare prior to being stopped.
member.remarks: The behaviour of the default implementation depends upon the type of host. If the component is running in a or an , this method always returns true. Otherwise, it checks the property to see if data has been modified. If data has been modified, a standard confirmation dialog is presented, asking the user whether the changes should be discarded, or the exit cancelled.
member.returns: True if there are no modifications or the user elects to discard modifications, otherwise false.

member.name: P:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationComponent.ExportedActions
member.summary: Returns the set of actions that the component wishes to export to the desktop.

member.name: P:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationComponent.GlobalActionsNamespace
member.summary: Allows the component to specify the namespace that qualifies its global action models. This value should not be null.

remarks.para: This value is used by the default implementation of to qualify the action model to be used for the global toolbar and menu sites.
The default implementation returns the default global action model namespace.

member.summary: Applies any changes from the contained pages.

remarks.para: If this method is not overridden, it will essentially do nothing other than set to false; therefore, you should override it if is true.

If and only if there are no validation errors will be set to false. Overriding methods can use the value of to decide whether or not to perform an action as a result of the user having clicked the Apply button (e.g. check that it is indeed false, then apply).

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask
member.summary: Provides a simple mechanism for executing code asynchronously.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Run(Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Action,Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Action)
member.summary: Runs specified code asynchronously, executing the continuation code when the asynchronous code completes.
member.remarks: The block is executed on the thread pool. When this block completes, the block is executed on the calling thread. If an exception is thrown in the async block, the exeception is logged and the continuation code is not executed. This method returns immediately to the caller. Subsequent calls to this method will cause any pending prior call to be effectively abandoned.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Run(Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Action,Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Action,System.Action{System.Exception})
member.summary: Runs specified code asynchronously, executing the continuation code when the asynchronous code completes.
member.remarks: The block is executed on the thread pool. When this block completes, the block is executed on the calling thread. If an exception is thrown in the async block, the is executed instead of the continuation block. This method returns immediately to the caller. Subsequent calls to this method will cause any pending prior call to be effectively abandoned.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Cancel
member.summary: Causes any pending asynchronous execution to be discarded (the continuation/error handler will not be called).

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.DefaultErrorHandler(System.Exception)
member.summary: Default error handler, used when no error handler is explicitly provided.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Dispose
member.summary: Performs application-defined tasks associated with freeing, releasing, or resetting unmanaged resources.
member.remarks: Cancels any pending asynchronous results.

member.name: P:Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.ThreadCulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture for the asynchronous task. If NULL, the culture will not be modified.

member.name: P:Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.ThreadUICulture
member.summary: Gets or sets the culture used by the Resource Manager to look up culture-specific resources for the asynchronous task. If NULL, the culture will not be modified.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationThemeResourceResolver
member.summary: An -enabled implementation of .

remarks.para: Resolves resources by searching the set of assemblies (specified in the constructor) in order for a matching resource. If the application is currently using a and the theme provides a matching resource, the themed resource will be returned.
Instances of this class are immutable and thread-safe.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationToolExtensionPoint
member.summary: Defines an extension point for application tools, which are global to the application.
member.remarks: Application tools are global to the application. An application tool is instantiated exactly once. Application tools cannot have actions because they are not associated with any UI entity. Extensions should expect to recieve a tool context of type .

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.Application
member.summary: Singleton class that represents the desktop application.

remarks.para: This class extends and provides the implementation of for a desktop application. This class may be subclassed if necessary. In order for the framework to use the subclass, it must be passed to . (Typically this is done by passing the class name as a command line argument to the executable).

The class provides a number of static convenience methods that may be freely used by application code. These static members should not be considered thread-safe unless they specifically state that they are.
The property can be used to obtain the singleton instance of the class (or subclass).

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Application.MarshalDelegate(System.Delegate,System.Object[])
member.summary: Marshals a delegate over to the UI thread for execution.
member.remarks: If the current thread is not the UI thread, the delegate is "posted" to the UI thread for execution, otherwise it is executed immediately.
member.returns: True, if the delegate was (or will be) executed.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Application.ShowMessageBox(System.String,Macro.Common.MessageBoxActions)
member.summary: Shows a message box using the application name as the title.
member.remarks: It is preferable to use one of the Macro.Desktop.DesktopWindow.ShowMessageBox methods if a desktop window is available, since they will ensure that the message box window is associated with the parent desktop window. This method is provided for situations where a message box needs to be displayed prior to the creation of any desktop windows.
member.param: The message to display.
The actions that the user may take.
member.returns: The resulting action taken by the user.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Application.Quit
member.summary: Attempts to close all open desktop windows and terminate the application.
member.remarks: The request to quit is not guaranteed to succeed. Specifically, it will fail if an open workspace demands user-interaction in order to close, in which case the user may cancel the operation. The request may also be cancelled programmatically, by handlers of the event.
member.returns: True if the application successfully quits, or false if it does not.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Application.Shutdown
member.summary: Forcibly closes all open desktop windows and terminates the application.
member.remarks: The call will forcibly terminate the application without allowing desktop components to cancel the operation. To allow desktop components an opportunity to cancel the operation, consider calling instead.

member.summary: Initializes the application. Override this method to perform custom initialization.
member.remarks: Initializes the application, including the session manager, application tools and root window. The GUI toolkit and application view have already been initialized prior to this method being called.
member.param: Arguments passed in from the command line.
member.returns: True if initialization was successful, false if the application should terminate immediately.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.Actions.EnabledStateObserverAttribute
member.summary: Declares an observer binding for the enabled state of an action.
member.remarks: This attribute causes the enabled state of the action specified by the action ID to be bound to the state of the specified property on the class to which this attribute applies. The property name must refer to a public boolean property on the target class that has get access. The change event name must refer to a public event on the class that will fire whenever the state of the property changes.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Actions.ActionModelSettings.BuildAndSynchronize(System.String,System.String,Macro.Desktop.Actions.IActionSet)
member.summary: Builds an in-memory action model from the specified XML model and the specified set of actions.
member.remarks: The actions will be ordered according to the XML model. Any actions that are not a part of the XML model will be added to the memory model and inserted into the XML model based on a 'group hint'. The XML model is automatically persisted, and new models that have never before been persisted will be added.
member.param: A namespace to qualify the site.
The site.
The set of actions to include. This set should be prefiltered on .
member.returns: An representing the root of the action model.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Actions.ActionModelSettings.BuildAbstractActionModel(System.String,System.String,Macro.Desktop.Actions.IActionSet)
member.summary: Builds an in-memory abstract action model from the specified XML model and the specified set of known actions.
member.remarks: This method functions similarly to except that the resulting action model consists solely of s which are not actually associated with any concrete actions on tools or components.
member.param: A namespace to qualify the site.
The site.
The set of actions to include. This set should be prefiltered on .
member.returns: An representing the root of the action model.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Actions.ActionModelSettings.PersistAbstractActionModel(System.String,System.String,Macro.Desktop.Actions.ActionModelRoot)
member.summary: Persists an in-memory abstract action model to the XML model.
member.remarks: This method functions as a counterpart to . The specified abstract action model (created by , or potentially modified further) is flattened and its nodes written out to the XML mode, replacing any existing model at the same qualified site. This allows action model configuration interfaces to make changes to the action model.
member.param: A namespace to qualify the site.
The site.
The abstract action model to be persisted.
member.returns: An representing the root of the action model.

member.summary: Builds a map of action IDs to actions.
member.param: the set of actions from which to build a map
member.returns: a map of action IDs to actions

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Actions.ActionModelSettings.CreateXmlActionModel(System.String)
member.summary: Creates the specified action model, but *does not* immediately append it to the xmlDoc. Since not all actions are persistent (e.g. some could be generated), we need to figure out how many actions (if any) belonging to the node will be persisted in the store before adding the action to the store.
member.param: the id of the "action-model" to create

member.summary: Defines the interface to a tree, which provides a presentation model for viewing hierarchical data.

member.summary: Obtains the that defines how items in this tree are mapped to the view.

member.name: P:Macro.Desktop.Trees.ITree.Items
member.summary: Obtains a reference to the collection of items in this tree.

remarks.para: Note that this collection contains only the immediate items. Each item may provide a sub-tree, which can be obtained via the method.

In general, it is advisable that the implementation of the root should encapsulate a single ancestor root tree item, whose is returned in . Because only the root's children are returned in this interface, the tree view will still show them as "top-level" nodes, but they will still be related to each other through a common ancestor item. This is important, because a number of features, such as check states, reordering, and view updates triggered from the model side depend on the existence of a parent node.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.Actions.VisibleStateObserverAttribute
member.summary: Declares an observer binding for the visible state of an action.
member.remarks: This attribute causes the visible state of the action specified by the action ID to be bound to the state of the specified property on the class to which this attribute applies. The property name must refer to a public boolean property on the target class that has get access. The change event name must refer to a public event on the class that will fire whenever the state of the property changes.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Path.#ctor(System.String,Macro.Common.Utilities.IResourceResolver)
member.summary: Creates a new from the specified path string, resolving resource keys in the path string using the specified .

remarks.para: The path string is a string of the form A[/B[/C...]] where the forward slash delineates segments. To include a slash character as part of a segment, escape it by preceding it with a single quote, e.g. '/.

Each segment may be either a literal or a resource key. Localization will be attempted on each path segment by treating the segment as a resource key, and path segments that fail as resource keys will be treated as literals.

member.param: The path string to parse.
The to use for localization.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Path.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Creates a new from the specified path string, with no resource resolver.

remarks.para: The path string is a string of the form A[/B[/C...]] where the forward slash delineates segments. To include a slash character as part of a segment, escape it by preceding it with a single quote, e.g. '/.
The path string must only contain literals, because there is no resource resolver to perform localization.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.Actions.TooltipValueObserverAttribute
member.summary: Declares an observer binding for the Tooltip value of an action.
member.remarks: This attribute causes the Tooltip value of the action specified by the action ID to be bound to the state of the specified property on the class to which this attribute applies. The property name must refer to a public string property on the target class that has get access. The change event name must refer to a public event on the class that will fire whenever the value of the property changes.

member.summary: Begins a transaction, returning a scope object that must be disposed to denote the end of the transaction.
member.remarks: This is not a transaction in the true sense, because it cannot be rolled back. The purpose of the transaction is to allow objects that are listening for events to know that a number of changes are being made in close succession that ought to be considered part of a single logical change.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.Actions.ActionPermissionAttribute
member.summary: Associates authority tokens with an action.
member.remarks: This attribute sets the action permissibility via the method. If multiple authority tokens are supplied in an array to a single instance of the attribute, those tokens will be combined using AND. If multiple instances of this attribute are specified, the tokens associated with each instance are combined using OR logic. This allows for the possibility of constructing a permission specification based on a complex boolean combination of authority tokens.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.Actions.GroupHint
member.summary: The GroupHint is used to determine a reasonably appropriate point in the action model to put an action that does not yet exist in the stored model.

remarks.para: The action (call it Left-Hand Action) whose position in the store is to be determined is compared with each action in the store (Right-Hand Action). The comparison of the Left-Hand Action to the Right-Hand Action is given a score. The score is based on the GroupHint and the algorithm works as follows:

LHS RHS Score ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- 1. Tools.Image.Manipulation.Zoom "" 1 2. Tools.Image.Manipulation.Zoom Tools.Image.Manipulation.Pan 4 3. Tools.Image.Manipulation.Zoom DisplaySets 0 4. "" "" 1 5. "" DisplaySets 0 6. Tools.Image.Manipulation.Pan Tools.Image.Manipulation.Zoom -4

A brief explanation of the logic:
For backward compatibility, actions with a non-empty GroupHint, when compared to an existing action in the store whose GroupHint="", the score is 1 because it is considered a better match than 2 actions whose GroupHints are non-empty and are completely different.
Actions with GroupHints that have similar components (separated by '.') are given a score equal to the number of (consecutive) matching components + 1. The +1 accounts for the fact that any number of equal components is a better score than the first example, whose score is 1. When all components in LHS are a match, but RHS has more components, the score is negative (less). When all components in RHS are a match, meaning LHS has at least the same number of components, the score is positive (greater). Otherwise, the sign of the score is determined by examining the first non-matching component (same position in LHS and RHS) encountered and performing a string comparison of the two. If the component in LHS is "less" than RHS, the return value is negative (less).
Actions with completely different components are given an automatic score of zero (0). Two actions with GroupHints = "" are considered equal, so a score of 1 is given.
In the case where an existing action with an empty GroupHint is being matched to a non-empty GroupHint, the LHS cannot be considered at all similar to RHS and the score is automatically zero (0).

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.ApplicationThemeManager
member.summary: Manages the s available in the application based on the enabled extensions in the plugins.

remarks.para: In order to provide for individual plugins providing all or part of a theme, the class is not designed to be directly extensible. Instead, plugins should implement s for the desired theme ID via the . The will automatically combine all extensions together by matching ID to produce appropriate instances.
In the event that multiple s try to provide for the same requested theme resource, extension ordering will determine the result of the request operation.

All explicitly defined application themes must have a non-empty theme ID. The empty theme ID maps to the , which provides a pass through to the original resources defined in the respective plugin assemblies, as well as the basic blue colour scheme.

member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The regular expression pattern to test.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Validation.ValidateRegexAttribute.CreateRule(System.Reflection.PropertyInfo,Macro.Desktop.Validation.ValidationAttribute.PropertyGetter,System.String)
member.summary: Factory method to create an based on this attribute.
member.param: The property on which the attribute is applied.
A delegate that, when invoked, returns the current value of the property.
A custom message to be displayed, or null if none was supplied.

member.name: P:Macro.Desktop.Validation.ValidateRegexAttribute.AllowNull
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether or not to allow a null/empty string.
member.remarks: If this property is set to true, a null/empty string is allowed even when the regex pattern would otherwise fail. In this case, the regex is not even tested if the property value is null. This allows for non-required fields to be validated only if a value was in fact supplied.

member.name: P:Macro.Desktop.Validation.ValidateRegexAttribute.SuccessOnMatch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether a successful match indicates a successful result.
member.remarks: For example, you may want to test that a string does not contain any 'a' or 'b' characters. In order to do this, you must specify = false and a pattern of "[ab]+". This pattern will result in a successful match, and there is no easy way to do a !(not) in regular expressions.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.IMemorable
member.summary: Allows object state to be captured and restored.

remarks.para: can be implemented by classes that require support for the Memento design pattern-- acts as the Originator. Typically, the interface is used in conjunction with to provide undo/redo support.

It is common in the framework to use a 'begin state' and 'end state' memento that comprise an . It is also common to check the equality of the two mementos in order to decide whether or not an should be added to a object. Therefore, it is good practice to override and implement the method on memento classes.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.IMemorable.CreateMemento
member.summary: Captures the state of an object.
member.remarks: The implementation of should return an object containing enough state information so that when is called, the object can be restored to the original state.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.IMemorable.SetMemento(System.Object)
member.summary: Restores the state of an object.
member.param: The object that was originally created with .
member.remarks: The implementation of should return the object to the original state captured by .

member.summary: Provides a simple mechanism for application components to execute code asynchronously.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.Async.Invoke(Macro.Desktop.IApplicationComponent,Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Action,Macro.Desktop.AsyncTask.Action,System.Action{System.Exception})
member.summary: Invokes an arbitrary block of code asynchronously, executing a continuation upon completion or error handler upon failure.
member.remarks: The invocation is tied to the lifetime of the specified application component. That is, if the component is stopped, any asynchronous invocations pending completion will be discarded.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.SuggestionProviderBase`1
member.summary: Abstract base class for implementations of that provides most of the boilerplate functionality.

remarks.para: This class implements a two-phase algorithm for providing a list of suggestions in response to a query string. In the first phase, the query string is used to obtain a "shortlist" of suggestions. Once the shortlist has been obtained, the second phase is entered, where subsequent refinements of the query string are used to refine the shortlist. Clearing the query string, or modifying it such that it is no longer a refinement of the query that generated the initial shortlist, causes a transition back to the first phase, where the query is used to obtain a new shortlist.

It is the responsibility of the subclass to obtain the shortlist by implementing the method. This method is always invoked on a background thread, in order to avoid locking up the user-interface. Therefore, the subclass need not worry about the duration of execution of this method (within reason). The method may return null in the event that the specified query string is too broad to return a shortlist. In this case, the method will be called repeatedly, with each change to the query string, until it returns a non-null value.

The subclass may choose to implement the refinement logic as well, by overriding . However, this is typically not necessary as several standard refinement strategies are provided. These are , which refines the list to include only those items that start with the query string, and , which refines the list to include only those items that contain all terms specified in the query string, regardless of the order of those terms. This is the default strategy used, in not explicitly specified.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.SuggestionProviderBase`1.GetShortList(System.String)
member.summary: Called to obtain the initial source list for the specified query. May return null if no items are available.

remarks.para: This method is called to obtain an initial list of items for a given query. The method should return null if no items are available for the specified query (or if the query is too "broad" to return any suggestions). This method is called repeatedly each time the user updates the query, until a non-null result is returned. Once this method returns a non-null result, it is not called again as long as subsequent queries are increasingly "specific", as defined by the implementation of . The method is called instead. However, as soon as a query is encountered that is less specific than the query that generated the shortlist (e.g. the user presses backspace enough times), this method will be called again to generate a new source list.

In order to keep the UI responsive, this method is invoked on a background thread, meaning that the implementation is free to make remote calls or perform other time consuming tasks to generate the list, without fear of locking up the UI.

member.name: T:Macro.Common.Utilities.ObservablePropertyCoupler`1
member.summary: Couples two instances of such that a change to the primary property will be propagated to the secondary property.
member.remarks: A bi-directional mode is also possible, where changes to the secondary property are also propagated back to the primary property. In this case, infinite mutual recursion is prevented by only propagating the change if the values are actually different. To remove the coupling, call on this object.
member.typeparam: The type of the bound property.

member.name: M:Macro.Common.Utilities.ObservablePropertyCoupler`1.Couple(Macro.Desktop.Actions.IObservablePropertyBinding{`0},Macro.Desktop.Actions.IObservablePropertyBinding{`0})
member.summary: Establishes the coupling between the specified primary and secondary properties.
member.remarks: The value of the secondary property will be initialized to the value of the primary property, and will continue to be synchronized for the duration of the lifetime of this object. To remove the coupling at any point in the future, retain the returned object, and call Dispose() on it to remove the coupling.
member.param: The primary property, which serves as the subject.
The secondary property, which observes the subject and tracks its value.
member.returns: A property coupler object, which can optionally be retained for eventual disposal.

member.name: M:Macro.Common.Utilities.ObservablePropertyCoupler`1.Couple(Macro.Desktop.Actions.IObservablePropertyBinding{`0},Macro.Desktop.Actions.IObservablePropertyBinding{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Establishes the coupling between the specified primary and secondary properties.
member.remarks: The value of the secondary property will be initialized to the value of the primary property, and will continue to be synchronized for the duration of the lifetime of this object. The coupling is optionally bi-directional, in which case changes made to the secondary property are also propagated back to the primary property. To remove the coupling at any point in the future, retain the returned object, and call Dispose() on it to remove the coupling.
member.param: The primary property, which serves as the subject.
The secondary property, which observes the subject and tracks its value.
If true, the primary property will also track the value of the secondary property.
member.returns: A property coupler object, which can optionally be retained for eventual disposal.

member.name: M:Macro.Common.Utilities.ObservablePropertyCoupler`1.#ctor(Macro.Desktop.Actions.IObservablePropertyBinding{`0},Macro.Desktop.Actions.IObservablePropertyBinding{`0},System.Boolean)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The primary property, which serves as the subject.
The secondary property, which observes the subject and tracks its value.
If true, the primary property will also track the value of the secondary property.

member.name: M:Macro.Common.Utilities.ObservablePropertyCoupler`1.Dispose
member.summary: Implementation of the pattern.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.ISessionManager
member.summary: Defines the interface to extensions of .

remarks.para: A session manager extension is optional. If present, the application will load the session manager and call its and at the beginning and end of the applications execution, respectively.

The purpose of the session manager is to provide a hook through which custom session management can occur. A typical session manager implemenation may show a login dialog at start-up in order to gather user credentials, and may perform other custom initialization.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.ISessionManager.InitiateSession
member.summary: Called by the framework at start-up to initiate a session.
member.remarks: This method is called after the GUI system and application view have been initialized, so the implementation may interact with the user if necessary, and may make use of the object. However, no desktop windows exist yet. Any exception thrown from this method will effectively prevent the establishment of a session, causing execution to terminate with an error. A return value of false may be used to silently refuse initiation of a session. In this case, no error is reported, but the application terminates immediately.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.ISessionManager.InvalidateSession
member.summary: Called to mark the existing session as invalid, which will typically require the user to re-authenticate in order to continue using the application.
member.remarks: Note that calling this method does not itself renew the session, but merely marks the session as invalid. Hence, the session not necessarily have been renewed yet when this method returns.

member.name: M:Macro.Desktop.ISessionManager.TerminateSession
member.summary: Called by the framework at shutdown to terminate an existing session.
member.remarks: This method is called prior to terminating the GUI subsytem and application view, so the implementation may interact with the user if necessary.

member.name: P:Macro.Desktop.ISessionManager.SessionStatus
member.summary: Gets the current status of the session.

member.name: E:Macro.Desktop.ISessionManager.SessionStatusChanged
member.summary: Occurs when the property changes.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.Configuration.LocalSettingsStore
member.summary: The LocalSettingsStore, although it implements does not serve as a proper settings store for the (notice that it is not an extension of . Instead, this class is instantiated directly by the when there are no such extensions available, and the application is using the (or app/user .config) to store settings locally. This 'settings store' is used solely to edit the default profile throught the settings management UI.

member.name: T:Macro.Desktop.Actions.IconSetObserverAttribute
member.summary: Declares an observer binding for the value of an action.
member.remarks: This attribute causes the value of the action specified by the action ID to be bound to the state of the specified property on the class to which this attribute applies. The property name must refer to a public property on the target class that has get access. The change event name must refer to a public event on the class that will fire whenever the value of the property changes.

member.summary: Attribute constructor.
member.param: The logical action identifier to which this attribute applies.
The name of the property to bind to.
The name of the property change notification event to bind to.
